text:
AirPods owners spend nearly $ 1 billion to replace lost headphones
01 Nov 2019, 16:04 by Ilya Sidorov
According to analysts, in 2019 Apple will sell AirPods for $ 10-12 billion. About 5-7% of this amount will be used to replace the missing headphones.
AirPods are very easy to lose due to their miniature size. When users discover a loss, they usually contact the service to get a new gadget.
Dan Ives of Wedbush believes that 99% of AirPods owners do this.
Topic: Why AirPods often lose in the subway of New York
For Apple, this is a rather big income item. In 2019, the company will earn $ 500-700 million by selling the missing headphone or charging case to users.
Users turn to the service not only when they lose the device, but also in case of battery aging. In this situation, they can also pay extra to get new AirPods. [Cbs]
